body_html:
Using Ubuntu, pip installation and latest TensorFlow (0.8.0). The issue seems to be, that my biases and weights go all to NaN objects, but I have no idea why. I remember getting similar error in the past, then Exception was thrown, now it is silent and training goes to end. Everything works well, if the network is smaller.

The issue seems to be about the learning rate. If it is too small or too big (0.000001 is too small, 0.1 is too big), weights and biases go to NaN really fast, when network has over 5 layers and over 300 neurons.

body:
Using Ubuntu, pip installation and latest TensorFlow (0.8.0). The issue seems to be, that my biases and weights go all to NaN objects, but I have no idea why. I remember getting similar error in the past, then Exception was thrown, now it is silent and training goes to end. Everything works well, if the network is smaller.

The issue seems to be about the learning rate. If it is too small or too big (0.000001 is too small, 0.1 is too big), weights and biases go to NaN really fast, when network has over 5 layers and over 300 neurons.
